workflow.name: Text-to-image generator with Google Sheets & Drive integration using Flux AI
workflow.description:
# üñºÔ∏è Text-to-Image Generator using n8n + Flux AI

This n8n workflow automates image generation from text prompts using the [Text-to-Image Flux AI API](https://rapidapi.com/PrineshPatel/api/text-to-image-flux-ai). It reads prompts from Google Sheets, generates images via API, uploads them to Google Drive, and logs the outcome.

---

## üåü Key Features

- Integrates with **[Text-to-Image Flux AI](https://rapidapi.com/PrineshPatel/api/text-to-image-flux-ai)** on RapidAPI
- Converts base64 image data to downloadable files
- Stores images on Google Drive
- Updates logs and errors back into Google Sheets
- Skips prompts already processed

---

## üìÑ Google Sheet Column Structure

Your source Google Sheet should include the following columns:

| Column Name       | Description                                      |
|-------------------|--------------------------------------------------|
| `Prompt`          | The text prompt to generate an image from        |
| `drive path`      | (Optional) File path or URL of saved image       |
| `Generated Date`  | Date/time the image was generated                |
| `Base64`          | Base64 string or error message (for logging)     |

Only rows with a non-empty `Prompt` **and** empty `drive path` will be processed.

---

## üìå Use Case

Perfect for:
- Bulk AI image generation for content marketing
- Creative automation with prompt-based image creation
- Building image assets based on structured datasets
- Any workflow where prompts are tracked via Google Sheets

Uses the [Text-to-Image Flux AI API](https://rapidapi.com/PrineshPatel/api/text-to-image-flux-ai) to generate high-quality images on demand.

---

## üîß Workflow Summary

| Step | Node | Description |
|------|------|-------------|
| 1 | Manual Trigger | Manually start the workflow |
| 2 | Google Sheets2 | Reads prompts from Google Sheets |
| 3 | Loop Over Items | Processes rows one by one |
| 4 | If2 | Skips rows that already have images |
| 5 | HTTP Request1 | Calls **Text-to-Image Flux AI** via RapidAPI |
| 6 | Code1 | Converts base64 image to binary file |
| 7 | Google Drive1 | Uploads the image file to a Drive folder |
| 8 | Google Sheets1 | Logs base64 result and timestamp back |
| 9 | If1 | Handles errors from the API |
| 10 | Google Sheets4 | Logs errors to the sheet |
| 11 | Wait | Adds delay between batches to prevent rate-limiting |

---

## üöÄ RapidAPI: Text-to-Image Flux AI

This flow is powered by **[Text-to-Image Flux AI](https://rapidapi.com/PrineshPatel/api/text-to-image-flux-ai)**.

 Be sure to:
- Sign up at RapidAPI and subscribe to the API.
 - Copy your API Key.
 - Replace `"your key"` in the `HTTP Request1` node‚Äôs `x-rapidapi-key` header.

You can test the API directly [here](https://rapidapi.com/PrineshPatel/api/text-to-image-flux-ai) before connecting it to n8n.

---

## ‚úÖ Tips for Setup

- Ensure you‚Äôve set up a **Google Service Account** with access to both Sheets and Drive.
- Fill only the `Prompt` column ‚Äî leave `drive path` and `Base64` empty for new prompts.
- Monitor your [RapidAPI dashboard](https://rapidapi.com/PrineshPatel/api/text-to-image-flux-ai) for usage and quota.

---
Create your **free n8n account** and set up the workflow in just a few minutes using the link below:

üëâ [Start Automating with n8n](https://n8n.partnerlinks.io/7fuarh1e6dz5)

Save time, stay consistent, and grow your LinkedIn presence effortlessly!

workflow.name: Text To Image Flux AI copy

parameters.content:
# Text To Image Flux AI Workflow

## Short Description
Automates the generation of images from text prompts stored in a Google Sheet, processes the image data, uploads the images to Google Drive, and updates the Google Sheet with the generated image data.

## Use Case
Ideal for content creators, marketers, or businesses who want to bulk-generate images based on text prompts stored in a spreadsheet without manual intervention.

## Problem Solved
Eliminates the manual process of creating images from text prompts, managing image data, and updating logs, streamlining and scaling image generation workflows.

---

## Workflow Steps (Summary)

1. **Manual Trigger**  
   Starts the workflow on demand.

2. **Google Sheets2**  
   Reads text prompts from a Google Sheet.

3. **Loop Over Items**  
   Processes each prompt individually in batches.

4. **If2 (Condition)**  
   Checks if the prompt is present and if the image is not already generated (`drive path` empty).

5. **HTTP Request1**  
   Sends the prompt to the Text To Image Flux AI API to generate the image.

6. **Code1**  
   Converts the base64 image string from the API response into a binary file.

7. **Google Sheets1**  
   Appends the base64 image data and generation timestamp back into the Google Sheet.

8. **Google Drive1**  
   Uploads the generated image file to a specified Google Drive folder.

9. **Google Sheets4**  
   Updates the original Google Sheet row with errors if any occur.

10. **Wait**  
    Pauses for 10 seconds between batches to avoid API rate limits or overload.

11. **If1 (Error Check)**  
    Detects if there is an error from the API call and routes accordingly.

---

### 1. When clicking ‚ÄòExecute workflow‚Äô (Manual Trigger)
- **Type:** Manual trigger  
- **Purpose:** Starts the workflow manually when you click ‚ÄúExecute workflow.‚Äù  
- **Usage:** Initiates the entire process.

### 2. Google Sheets2 (Read Prompts)
- **Type:** Google Sheets node (read)  
- **Purpose:** Reads the list of text prompts from a Google Sheet.  
- **Usage:** Fetches data that drives the image generation process.

### 3. Loop Over Items (Split in Batches)
- **Type:** Split In Batches  
- **Purpose:** Processes each prompt individually in manageable batches to avoid API overload.  
- **Usage:** Allows sequential or batch processing of multiple prompts.

### 4. If2 (Check Prompt & Drive Path)
- **Type:** If node (conditional check)  
- **Purpose:** Checks if the prompt is present and the image has not already been generated (`drive path` is empty).  
- **Usage:** Prevents duplicate processing of prompts that already have generated images.

### 5. HTTP Request1 (Generate Image)
- **Type:** HTTP Request (POST)  
- **Purpose:** Sends the prompt to the Text To Image Flux AI API and receives a base64 encoded image.  
- **Usage:** Calls the external AI service for image generation.

### 6. Code1 (Convert Base64 to Binary)
- **Type:** Code (JavaScript)  
- **Purpose:** Converts the base64 image string into a binary format suitable for upload.  
- **Usage:** Prepares image data for Google Drive upload.

### 7. Google Sheets1 (Append Image Data)
- **Type:** Google Sheets node (append)  
- **Purpose:** Appends the generated base64 image and timestamp back to the Google Sheet.  
- **Usage:** Logs image generation results in the sheet for tracking.

### 8. Google Drive1 (Upload Image)
- **Type:** Google Drive node (upload)  
- **Purpose:** Uploads the generated image file to a specified Google Drive folder.  
- **Usage:** Stores the generated images in the cloud for easy access and sharing.

### 9. Google Sheets4 (Update Errors)
- **Type:** Google Sheets node (appendOrUpdate)  
- **Purpose:** Updates the Google Sheet with error information if image generation fails.  
- **Usage:** Tracks failures to allow debugging or reprocessing.

### 10. Wait (Pause Between Batches)
- **Type:** Wait node  
- **Purpose:** Adds a 10-second pause between batches of processed prompts.  
- **Usage:** Prevents hitting API rate limits or overloading the system.

### 11. If1 (Error Handling)
- **Type:** If node (error check)  
- **Purpose:** Checks if the API response contains an error.  
- **Usage:** Routes the flow to handle errors or continue successful processing.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
